result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larodney S Raymond

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larodney S Raymond in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Larodney S Raymond.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requested adjournment due to possible global resolution; parties still in negotiation status. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Larodney S Raymond.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Francesco Mineo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense Motion for Bail Modification heard and argued.  Motion DENIED.  The previously set cash bail remains at $5,000.00. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Discussion held regarding possible global offer with other pending case 21CF2795 currently before this Court.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date be set to track with other case.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defense's Motion for Bail Modification; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Larodney S Raymond appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Wendy Patrickus appeared by video on behalf of Attorney James Edgar Toran for Larodney S Raymond.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #21CF2795. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Abdulghani.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
On the court's own motion bail is reduced. All other conditions remain as previously set.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned due to State's Witness having to leave for a personal emergency. Defense made a motion to dismiss due to previous adjournments. Court took motion of defense under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, appear by video. Defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report received and filed.  bm
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Larodney S. Raymond - #2022007892, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Letter from defendant.  (Larodney S. Raymond - #2022007892, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court by video, defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is at a gun training. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Larodney S Raymond in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Larodney S Raymond in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Larodney S Raymond appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
